import numpy as np
# (num_x_winning_lines and description)
# Usefulness: This feature directly counts how many of the 8 possible winning lines (3 rows, 3 columns, 2 diagonals) contain three 'x' marks ('1'). If this value is greater than zero, 'x' has won the game, making this feature a direct indicator for the "positive" outcome. It will be highly discriminative for the target variable 'Class', where 'positive' means 'win for x'.
# Input samples: 'top-left-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(1), np.int64(1)], 'top-middle-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(1), np.int64(1)], 'middle-middle-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(2), np.int64(2)]
df['num_x_winning_lines'] = ((df['top-left-square'] == 1) & (df['top-middle-square'] == 1) & (df['top-right-square'] == 1)).astype(int) + \
                             ((df['middle-left-square'] == 1) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 1) & (df['middle-right-square'] == 1)).astype(int) + \
                             ((df['bottom-left-square'] == 1) & (df['bottom-middle-square'] == 1) & (df['bottom-right-square'] == 1)).astype(int) + \
                             ((df['top-left-square'] == 1) & (df['middle-left-square'] == 1) & (df['bottom-left-square'] == 1)).astype(int) + \
                             ((df['top-middle-square'] == 1) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 1) & (df['bottom-middle-square'] == 1)).astype(int) + \
                             ((df['top-right-square'] == 1) & (df['middle-right-square'] == 1) & (df['bottom-right-square'] == 1)).astype(int) + \
                             ((df['top-left-square'] == 1) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 1) & (df['bottom-right-square'] == 1)).astype(int) + \
                             ((df['top-right-square'] == 1) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 1) & (df['bottom-left-square'] == 1)).astype(int)

This complements 'num_x_winning_lines' by specifically identifying states where 'o' has won, providing distinct information about the board state that is crucial for distinguishing 'negative' cases (e.g., 'o' win versus a draw).
# Input samples: 'top-left-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(2), np.int64(1)], 'top-middle-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(1), np.int64(2)], 'top-right-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(1), np.int64(1)]
df['num_o_winning_lines'] = ((df['top-left-square'] == 2) & (df['top-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['top-right-square'] == 2)).astype(int) + \

                             ((df['top-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-middle-square'] == 2)).astype(int) + \
